superseding_details.component_description: Remediation works aiming to replace existing facade materials with materials of a similar or identical appearance and colour

description: Replacement of timber facade at ground floor level and soffits to elevations of Norway House and Downham Wharf.
decision_conditions: <p>Tree protection for all retained trees at the site and on adjacent land shall be undertaken in accordance with BS5837:2012 (Trees in relation to construction - Recommendations) and will protect the root protection area calculated as described in Table 2 of that British Standard for the duration of all site works (including demolition) undertaken in connection with the development hereby approved.</p><p>The protective fencing will be 2.4m high and conform to Figure 2 of BS5837:2012 i.e. a scaffold framework comprising a vertical and horizontal framework, well braced to resist impacts, with vertical tubes spaced at a maximum interval of 3m.&nbsp; On to this weldmesh panels should be securely fixed with wire or scaffold clamps.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In order to protect the existing trees during building operation and site works.</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
subdivision_of_building: Proposals only cover facades that require fire safety remedial works as identified on enclosed elevations.
